head.supplied: 28/5/91 ¶ We the Undersigned beg to recommend: ¶ ¶ Henry Herbert Sutherland Esq. ¶ licenced Surveyor under the Government of N. S. Wales, for the fellowship of the Linnean Society of England, for whi...

div.p: To the Linnean Society of London
Linnean Society, London, Certificates of Fellows, Foreign Members and Associates, 1891-97.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: M autograph text and signature; additional supporters' individual signatures. 28/5/91
We the Undersigned beg to recommend:

Henry Herbert Sutherland Esq.
M has given Sutherland's second name incorrectly; it was ‘Hubert’; see notice of his being appointed a licensed surveyor, New South Wales Government Gazette, 29 January 1873, p. 269.
licenced Surveyor under the Government of N. S. Wales, for the fellowship of the Linnean Society of England, for which honor he is worthy through his zealous palaeontologic researches.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
William Woolls Ph.D., F.L.S.
The nomination was forwarded by William Woolls to the Linnean Society in a letter of 5 June 1891 in which he identified Sutherland as living at Bathurst and said that he ‘is connected with one of our most respected medical practitioners’. Sutherland was the step-son of W. F. Bassett.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
C. S. Wilkinson F.L.S.
Annotated bottom front: Read 5 Novbr 1891 Ballot 3 Decr 1891.
Sutherland was elected (Proceedings of the Linnean Society of London, 1891-2 session, p. 46).
